alert.note: Alert for McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:21PM CDT until July 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL HENDERSON...MCNAIRY...HARDIN...CHESTER AND DECATUR COUNTIES... At 320 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mifflin to near Shiloh to near Corinth, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Savannah, Henderson, Selmer, Pickwick Landing State Park, Parsons, Adamsville, Decaturville, Sardis, Pickwick Dam, Masseyville, Reagan, Jacks Creek, Mifflin, Morris Chapel, Shiloh, Walnut Grove, Olive Hill, Darden and Montgomery. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across McNairy County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Memphis. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
